member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.VersionControlArtifactProvider
member.summary:
The SourceControlArtificatProvider implements IArtifactProvider making available, the source control artifacts in their general form. This includes through an Artifact object, or via the XML Document that describes the basic data.
Additionlly it implements methods to retrieve the artifacts and convert them into the real objects that are unsd in the object model. This allows clients to have full access to the API even if they only have an artifact Uri.

member.returns: The type of artifact this Uri represents; returns VersionControlArtifactType.None if it does not represent a known source control artifact type

member.summary: Update the saved channel info with the current check states. The specified checked states may be a filtered subset of the overall set of pending changes so this list does not replace the current channel checked states. Instead, this method ensures that the specified checked states exist in saved channel info and the unchecked changes do not.
member.param: the set of checked pending changes to merge with the overall set of checked items
the set of unchecked pending changes to remove from the overall set of checked items

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CheckinEvaluationOptions.AddMissingFieldValues
member.summary:
Supply this bit only in combination with the Notes bit. Indicates that the EvaluateCheckin family of methods should modify the CheckinNote object provided to add CheckinNoteFieldValues for checkin notes that are defined, but for which no value was supplied. The values will be added with a value of String.Empty.
The string casing of the Name portion of each CheckinNoteFieldValue provided by the caller will also be corrected to match the casing in the corresponding CheckinNoteFieldDefinition.

member.summary:
Pends changes in the specified workspace on the specified server.
NOTE: The mid-tier requires that all ChangeRequests be of the same ChangeRequestType and that each item appears in only one request. If the same item appears more than once, the mid-tier only processes the first ChangeRequest for that item.
member.param: the changes to pend
if true, the local disk is updated according to the pending changes; if false, the disk is not modified and changes are not acknowledged
member.returns: the number of pending changes
member.param: The set of PendChanges options, not including the supported feature flags.

member.summary: Takes a list of candidates for AutoResolve and attempts to resolve them with the correct resolution and performing a content merge if necessary.
Performs a merge of the source to the target.
member.param: the workspace
the source of the merge (local or server path)
the target of the merge (local or server path -- must be mapped)
the starting version (may be null)
the ending version (may be null)
the lock level to apply to each item specified by the target
the merge options specified
List of attribute names to return with the get ops.
List of property names to return with the get ops.
member.returns: status information

member.summary: Pends a rollback for changes which happened to a certain path, within the specified versions
member.param: The workspace in which the rollback will be pended
An array of itemSpecs (path and recursion filter)
The version spec used to identify the path the user is referring to
The version we are rolling back from
The version we are rolling back to
The lock level to apply to each item being rolled back
Options to use.
member.returns: Status information

member.summary: Unshelves the pending changes from the specified shelveset. Throws an UnshelveException if unshelving fails on the server.
member.param: The name of the shelveset to unshelve
The name of the user who created the shelveset
The workspace to unshelve the changest into.
A list of files and/or folders within the shelveset that should be unshelved or null for all
A list of versioned item properties to return with each get operation
A list of shelveset properties to return with the shelveset object.
True if "merge" should be performed when unshelving. This will file merge and version conflicts for items that have conflicting pending changes and different pended versions respectively.
Prevents any conflicts from being auto resolved even if the option is set in the registry.
Return the set of unshelved pending changes
The list of conflicts that were generated by the unshelve operation. Conflicts are only filed if the merge parameter is true. In the case where merge is false an empty array will be returned.
member.returns: the Shelveset that was unshelved or null if the unshelving failed

Get all of the specified items to the specified workspace.
Note that Preview will not always show exactly what will happen. Some conflicts such as SourceDirectoryNotEmpty are artificially created when using Preview (it can't actually delete files, so the directory isn't empty) and others are not generated even though they should be, such as lacking the permissions to delete a file.
member.param: The workspace to get into.
The list of items to get; if null or empty, get the latest version of all items the workspace.
The options for this get.
member.returns: An object describing the number of operations, failures, and conflicts.

member.summary: Performs a Get like the other overload, but this one adds the ability for the user to specify a delegate to be called to filter the operations before they are processed.

Paths of files causing SourceWritable or TargetWritable conflicts

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions
member.summary: These options control how the conflict resolution code processes the conflict.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.IsEncodingOverride
member.summary: Set this to true to indicate that the file involved should be treated as the though the file's encoding is the one specified by the Encoding property. This property and IsConvertToEncoding must not both be true at the same time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.IsConvertToEncoding
member.summary: Set this to true to indicate that the files should be converted to the one specified by the Encoding property. This property and IsEncodingOverride must not both be true at the same time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding to use when the encoding is being either overridden or converted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.UseInternalEngine
member.summary: If true, the built-in merge engine is used rather than a registered third-party app.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.AcceptMergeEncoding
member.summary: When a conflict is to be resolved with the AcceptMerge resolution and there is a conflicting pending encoding change, this property contains the desired encoding. If this property is set to EncodingUnchanged, the conflict will not be resolved. Note that there is no encoding conversion associated with this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.AcceptMergeProperties
member.summary: When a conflict is to be resolved with the AcceptMerge resolution and there is a conflicting pending property change, this property contains the desired properties. If this propert is left as null, the conflict will not be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.AcceptMergeWithConflicts
member.summary: When true, content conflicts will not prevent the AcceptMerge resolution from resolving a conflict. The resulting file will contain conflict markers and require manual editing. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ResolutionOptions.NewPath
member.summary:
When a conflict is to be resolved, and the conflited item, or the item that is in the way needs to move to a new location, then this property is set to that location.
Examples: When a merge conflict is to be resolved with the AcceptMerge resolution and there is a conflicting pending rename, this property contains the desired name. If the name is null, the conflict will not be resolved. When a namespace conflict is to be resolved with the AcceptTheirs resolution, this property contains the new location of the item coming down in the conflict. When a namespcae conflict is to be resolved with the AcceptYours resolution, this property contains the new location of the local item that was in the way of the server item that wanted to come down in the conflict.

member.summary: Queue a notification with the NotificationManager to be posted as a x-process notification the next time its timer goes off. There are two parameters passed to the notification manager. The first is the GUID of the server, which will be used to generate a hash to identify the relevant server for the message, if the receiving window is capable of understanding GUID server identification (Orcas SP1 and later). The second parameter is the string "workspacename;username" which will be hashed and sent in all cases.
member.param: workspace changed
The kind of notification to send

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CrossProcessNotification.MatchesServerAndWorkspace(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Guid,System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary:
We got a notification in from some other process using the TF.Client notificationmanager class. We have two 32-bit values -- a hashcode identifying the server and a hashcode identifying the workspace.
Potential server hash code formats:
Dev10+ InternalHashMethod(serverGuid.ToString("D").ToUpperInvariant()) Orcas SP1 Hash of the relevant server's GUID (a 128-bit value hashed to 32 bits) Orcas RTM Hash of the server URI. Whidbey There were no cross process notifcations in Whidbey.
Potential workspace hash code formats:
Dev10+ InternalHashMethod(workspaceName;workspaceOwner) Orcas SP1 String.GetHashCode(workspaceName;workspaceOwner) // Generated in 32bit (x86) only Orcas RTM Same as Orcas SP1.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CrossProcessNotification.WorkspaceNotificationData
member.summary: A class containing data needed for AdjustNotificationParametersForWindow. We capture this data instead of putting the Workspace itself as the userData, in order to prevent the NotificationManager's delivery queue from rooting the Workspace in the garbage collector.

members.member:
Create a DiffItem for the target version of the given item. This method is used to create a DiffItem for a version of an item for which the path is not known, based on a pending change on that item.
This method calls an overload of CreateTargetDiffItem with the item id, version, and one of the paths from the pending change. The path used is determined based on the type of change. The version control server. A pending change on the item The version of the item for which the path is not known A DiffItem for the targetVersion version of the item

member.summary: Create a DiffItem for the target version of the given item. This method is used to create a DiffItem for a version of an item for which the path is not known, based on the item id and the known path for a different version.
member.param: The version control server.
The item id of the item
A known local or server path for the item
The version corresponding to the local or server path
Deletion id for the item or 0
The version of the item for which the path is not known
member.returns: A DiffItem for the targetVersion version of the item

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Difference.CreateTargetDiffItem(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.VersionControlServer,System.String,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.VersionSpec,System.Int32,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.VersionSpec)
member.summary: Create a DiffItem for the target version of the given item. This method is used to create a DiffItem for a version of an item for which the path is not known, based on a known path for a different version. This method uses a call to QueryHistory to get a server Item for the target version.
member.param: The version control server.
A known local or server path for the item
The version corresponding to the local or server path
Deletion id for the item or 0
The version of the item for which the path is not known
member.returns: A DiffItem for the targetVersion version of the item

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Failure
member.summary: Represents a failure returned by the server.

The Failure object contains much of the same information as an exception but is not derived from Exception and is now throwable.
Commands that operate on a collection of items, each of which may succeed or fail independently of the others will return an array of Failure objects representing the items that had trouble.
The Failure object also contains fields that describe the context in which the error occurred. A smart client may use these to make decisions about how to handle the error. Irrelevant info remains null and will not be sent as part of the soap reply.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CheckinNoteFieldDefinition
member.summary: Represents a checkin note field definition.

A field definition is used to define how a given named input is treated when applied to a given checkin note. These are not versioned and can change over time, allowing the definition and the data to become out of sync with each other. The definition is used at the time the checkin note is generated

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CheckinNoteFieldDefinition.Consolidate(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CheckinNoteFieldDefinition})
member.summary: Given a set of CheckinNoteFieldDefinitions which may have been sourced from multiple team projects, return a set of CheckinNoteFieldDefinitions with distinct keys (Name). When a collision on name occurs, the collision is resolved using the following method: 1. If some of the participants in a collision are required and others are not, the ones that are required are the only candidates for selection. 2. The participant in the collision with the server path that is highest alphabetically will be selected. The CheckinNoteFieldDefinitions will be sorted by server path and then display order, and renumbered so that the display order values are also unique and monotonically increasing.
member.param: Definitions to consolidate
member.returns: Consolidated definitions

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CheckinNoteFieldDefinition.NameComparer
member.summary: Return a name-based comparer object for FieldDefintion objects for display purposes (culture sensitive and case insensitive).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.CheckinNoteFieldDefinition.DisplayOrderComparer
member.summary: Return a display-order based comparer object for FieldDefintion objects for display purposes (culture sensitive and case insensitive).

member.summary: The displayOrder property is used to give the client a hint in how an input or output form will be displayed. These are guidelines and are not fixed given a checkin not instance can have cross definition values.

member.summary: This is the name of the field.

member.summary: Required tells the client whether or not the value is allowed to be left empty or a value must be supplied.

member.summary: Creates a new file system walker. Repeated calls to Walk() return the matching files.
member.param: the workspace in which files are being added
the file spec filter(s)
if false, process only the directory specified by fileSpec; if true, walk the file system recursively starting at fileSpec
if true, include directories in the results; if false, include only files
if false, treats missing files as non fatal errors

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileSystemWalker.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Walks the file system finding the files that match the specified file name pattern. Only files that are actively mapped in the user's workspace (determined by the directory being processed) are included in the results. Non-fatal error events are generated for cases where file attributes are not accessible due to security restrictions. Any directories without working folder mappings are skipped with non-fatal error events generated.
member.returns: yields each file or directory
member.exception: thrown if more than one workspace is encountered

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileType.Detect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines the file encoding by either using what the caller specifies or auto-detecting the file type. Setting encoding to null or using an encoding of "auto" forces auto-detection.
member.param: local file to consider
if non-null, the encoding to use rather than auto detection
member.returns: the encoding for the file as determined by this method

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileType.Detect(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines the file encoding by either using what the caller specifies or auto-detecting the file type. Setting encoding to null or using an encoding of "auto" forces auto-detection.
member.param: local file to consider
if non-null, the encoding to use rather than auto detection
if true, treats missing file as binary
member.returns: the encoding for the file as determined by this method

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileType.Detect(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Failure[]@)
member.summary: Determines the file encoding by either using what the caller specifies or auto-detecting the file type. Setting encoding to null or using an encoding of "auto" forces auto-detection.
member.param: local file to consider
if non-null, the encoding to use rather than auto detection
if true, treats missing file as binary
member.returns: the encoding for the file as determined by this method

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileType.DetermineEncoding(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Failure[]@)
member.summary: Determines the encoding for a file by first checking for the Unicode byte order mark. If it is Unicode, the particular encoding is returned. If it does not contain the Unicode BOM and checkForBinary is false, the current encoding is returned (aka the OEM code page). When checkForBinary is true and the file does not contain the BOM, the encoding returned is null if there are NUL bytes in the first 1K of the file or is the current encoding if there are no NUL bytes.
member.param: the path to the file to check
if true, check the file for null bytes
if true, treats missing file as binary
returns array of failures
member.returns: the encoding for the file or null if checkForBinary is true and NUL characters are present in the file

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileType.AllowMultipleCheckout
member.summary: If false, all "edit" checkouts will require exclusive locks

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileType.Extensions
member.summary: List of extensions these settings apply to. Do not include the * or . (example: txt)

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileType.Name
member.summary: Name of the filetype. Designed to be user-readable, but must be unique.

member.summary: Get the failures generated by this invocation of get.
member.returns: the set of failures

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumFailures
member.summary: Normally this is the number of failures returned by the server. If Get() is called with one or more items specified and they all fail to be valid local paths in the same workspace, this will be set to the number of items passed in (in that case, the server was never called).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumOperations
member.summary: The number of operations returned by the server. If the server returned no operations and no failures, everything was already up to date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumFiles
member.summary: The number of files downloaded from the server. If the server returned no operations and no failures, everything was already up to date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumBytes
member.summary: The number of bytes in all the files downloaded from the server. If the server returned no operations and no failures, everything was already up to date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumConflicts
member.summary: The number of conflicts encountered by get.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumResolvedConflicts
member.summary: The number of conflicts resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumUpdated
member.summary: The number of operations which updated the workspace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NumWarnings
member.summary: The number of warnings encountered by get.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.NoActionNeeded
member.summary: When true, Get() had nothing to do (server returned no operations and no failures).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetStatus.HaveResolvableWarnings
member.summary: Set to true when at least one warning is resolvable.

member.summary: Source paths of files that are causing SourceWritable or TargetWritable conflicts and were moved

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation
member.summary: An entry in the "to do" list that Get returns to the client. Each instance of this class represents an item that needs something done on the client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation
member.summary: Represents an operation returned by the server to be used by the client to update the local disk. The primary use of this interface is for the GetFilterCallback delegate mechanism, which receives an ILocalUpdateOperation[] to evaluate, for the purpose of setting the Ignore flag on some or all of the ILocalUpdateOperation objects it receives.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.ItemType
member.summary: Indicates whether this item is a file or a folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.ItemId
member.summary: The unique item ID for this item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.DeletionId
member.summary: If this item is deleted, this is its unique deletion ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.ChangeType
member.summary: If this item has a pending change or is affected by a parent recursive pending change (delete, rename) this is the changetype affecting the item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.PendingChangeId
member.summary: If this item has a pending change, the unique pending change ID for that pending change.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.TargetLocalItem
member.summary: The local destination for the item. It is null for deletes as well as for items move to cloaked or unmapped locations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.SourceLocalItem
member.summary: The local path where the item currently exists. It is null if the workspace does not have the item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.TargetServerItem
member.summary: The server path of the item. While this is not normally null, there are cases where this path is null, such as when the operation is an update to clean up an unfinished undo of an add or branch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.VersionServer
member.summary: This is the version that the workspace should have based on the request. It may be zero for cases such as cloaked or unmapped items.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.VersionLocal
member.summary: This is the version the workspace has. It is zero if the workspace doesn't have the item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.IsDelete
member.summary: True if this operation will result in the item being deleted from the local disk.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.IsConflict
member.summary: True if this operation is detected by the server as being in conflict.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ILocalUpdateOperation.Ignore
member.summary: When set to true by a GetFilterCallback, this operation will be ignored.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.AfterDeserialize
member.summary: Called after a GetOperation is created from XML.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.CurrentLocalItem
member.summary: The current local item is the source local item, unless ClearLocalItem() has been called, in which case it is null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.Microsoft#TeamFoundation#VersionControl#Client#ILocalUpdateOperation#ChangeType
member.summary: This code is used for the GetFilterCallback mechanism. The type passed to GetFilterCallback is not GetOperation but rather ILocalUpdateOperation, and the behavior of the ChangeType property of an ILocalUpdateOperation is special. When you call the ChangeType property of an ILocalUpdateOperation, you get routed here instead of to the 'normal' ChangeType property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.Ignore
member.summary: True if this GetOperation should be ignored by the client-side Get logic. When a filtered Get is performed, the provided callback may set Ignore to true on the ILocalUpdateOperation objects it receives. That is this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.HasPendingChange
member.summary: True if associated pending change is not caused just by pending change on the parent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.DownloadUrl
member.summary: The download URL for this GetOperation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.SourceServerItem
member.summary: Name of the file or folder in the server's repository path space. If null this means that this is a pre-Dev11 server which doesn't support sending it back

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.BaselineFileGuid
member.summary: Byte representation of the guid that is used to locate original file content in the baseline folder. This is populated only when new content was / will be downloaded using this GetOperation object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.LocalVersionEntry
member.summary: Before looping through the GetOperations and calling ProcessOperation on each one, a pass is made to tag GetOperations meeting certain criteria with their local version entries. This data is needed at ProcessOperation time to determine whether or not to file a writable file conflict.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.IsSourceLocalCleared
member.summary: Set to true if the Get client-side logic has stomped on the source local item of this GetOperation before processing it. If true, while the object sent from the server has a source local item, by the time this GetOperation is processed, it effectively no longer does.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.OkayToOverwriteExistingLocal
member.summary: This flag indicates that writable file conflicts should be suppressed for this GetOperation, if the target local item is equal to the source local item. This flag is set when undoing an edit and when performing certain types of resolves (AcceptTheirs on an edit, for example).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.ConflictingItemId
member.summary: The ItemId of the conflicting pending change. This is useful for detecting namespace conflicts on the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.DeletionId
member.summary: This is the deletion id for the item, non-zero means its deleted

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.Encoding
member.summary: The committed encoding of the item. If it is a pending add or branch, this is the encoding of that.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.HashValue
member.summary: This is the MD5 Hash Value of the contents of the version of the file that you are being told to get.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.InternalPropertyValues
member.summary: Properties

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.IsLatest
member.summary: This is set to true when this getoperation is telling the caller that they are acting on the latest version of this item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.LockLevel
member.summary: The lock level represents locks applied directly to this item. If the item is a folder it implies a lock to all subitems.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.PendingChangeId
member.summary: This Idenitifier represents a unique value attached to the change. It may be used to match up pending changes between calls.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.SourceLocalItem
member.summary: This is the current location/name of the file or folder if the client has an existing version of this item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.TargetLocalItem
member.summary: This is the target location/name of the file or folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.TargetServerItem
member.summary: Name of the file or folder in pending space

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.VersionLocal
member.summary: The version (changeset number) that you currently have in your workspace

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.VersionRevertTo
member.summary: Version number that should be reverted to for this committed item if the change where to be undone.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.VersionServer
member.summary: Version number of the item that the client should have in its workspace (changeset number)

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.GetOperation.VersionServerDate
member.summary: The date / time the server version was committed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.BaselineFolder.EnsureLocalMetadataDirectoryExists(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace)
member.summary:
Ensures that the local metadata directory for the given local workspace exists. The path looks like: @"C:\ProgramData\TFS\Offline\11c92875-fac4-4277-afba-d16f6eeb2189\ws1;NORTHAMERICA;phkelley"
The method has special logic to place an access control entry on the folder for the owner, and to take ownership from BUILTIN\Administrators. (This logic only runs if the directory is actually created by this method.)
member.param: Workspace whose local metadata directory's existence should be ensured

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.BaselineFolder.EnsureLocalMetadataDirectoryExists(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace,System.String)
member.summary:
Ensures that the local metadata directory for the given local workspace exists. The path looks like: @"C:\ProgramData\TFS\Offline\11c92875-fac4-4277-afba-d16f6eeb2189\ws1;NORTHAMERICA;phkelley"
The method has special logic to place an access control entry on the folder for the owner, and to take ownership from BUILTIN\Administrators. (This logic only runs if the directory is actually created by this method.)
The method will also clone any additional access control entries from the provided sourceDirectoryForAcl directory.
member.param: Workspace whose local metadata directory's existence should be ensured
Source directory for the access control list

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.BaselineFolderCollection.GetNewBaselineLocation(System.Byte[],System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Given a baseline file GUID, and the target local path where the item will be placed in the workspace, returns the path (without file extension) where the baseline file should be created on disk. This method is used to place new baselines on disk.
Do not use this method to look up the location of a baseline that already exists. Instead, call GetBaselineLocation().
This overload of GetNewBaselineLocation is intended to be used by those callers who are already holding a read lock on the BaselineFolderCollection. Pass the read lock token you received from LockForRead() as the readLockToken parameter to this method.
member.param: Baseline file GUID for the baseline
The location on disk of the file
member.returns: The filename on disk where the baseline should be placed (except for file extension)

member.summary: Given a baseline file GUID and a target location on disk, copies the baseline from the baseline store to the target location. (The target location always receives a decompressed copy of the baseline, even if it is stored compressed in the baseline folder.)

Target location for the baseline file
(optional) If provided, the uncompressed baseline length will be compared against this value and checked after decompression. If the values do not match, an exception will be thrown.

member.summary: The baseline file GUID which was generated and already persisted in the local version table with the entry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.BaselineRequest.BaselinePartitionLocalItem
member.summary: This is only used in combination with the baseline file GUID to figure out what baseline directory to put the file into. (There is one per partition.) If you don't know what partition the baseline file should live on, it's OK for this value to be null. The baseline will be stored in an arbitrarily chosen partition's baseline folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.BaselineRequest.SourceLocalItem
member.summary: If set, then this path will be used as the baseline content. As the content is gzipped, it will be hashed and that hash will be compared at completion with the value stored in HashValue. If they differ, then the baseline request will try to fall back to the DownloadUrl, if available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.BaselineRequest.DownloadUrl
member.summary: The download URL to use to fetch the baseline content. Used if LocalItem is null or if the local item's hash value does not match our own HashValue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.BaselineRequest.HashValue
member.summary: The hash value of the baseline content. (Optional.)

If you already have the workspace locked, and are on a different thread from the one where you locked it (or don't know whether you are), then pass in that workspace lock here, and LocalWorkspaceTransaction will skip acquisition of the workspace lock (since you provided it yourself). In this case, LocalWorkspaceTransaction will not dispose the lock when you dispose it.
member.param: Local workspace on which to perform a transaction
WorkspaceLock instance which locks the local workspace (or null)

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.LocalWorkspaceTransaction.PrepareToLoadFromBackup
member.summary: An error occurred while loading one of the tables from disk. We're about to retry, loading from our backup copy of the tables. Some of the tables might have already successfully loaded -- such as if we loaded WP and LV already, but the error occurred while trying to load PC. We want to load a consistent view of the tables, so we'll unload the tables we already opened and load them *all* from backup. This method just disposes all of our tables so we can start fresh again.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.LocalWorkspaceTransaction.DoAutoRecover(System.String)
member.summary: Given the presumed path for the local workspace properties table (WP), ensures that either the slot one or slot two (.tf1 or .tf2) path exists. If not, attempts to use the MappedPaths data from the WorkspaceInfo for this Workspace to locate a backup copy of the properties.tf1 file and restore it to the LocalMetadataDirectory for this workspace.
member.param: The presumed path for the local workspace properties table (WP)

member.summary: The last pending changes signature for this workspace that we have seen from the server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.OfflineCacheData.LastPendingChangesAttributes
member.summary: The last pending changes table file attributes for this workspace that we have seen on the client. This is for the case where two instances of the object model are running. An event on disk occurs, and both instances scan; the first one there creates a new pending change (or candidate) and raises an event. The second one to scan finds no work to do and would ordinarily not raise an event; but he sees that another process has modified the pending changes since he last closed the table, and raises an event (PendingChangesChanged) anyway.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.IPathChangedSink
member.summary: An interface to be implemented by objects which want to own a PathWatcher. This is essentially an event delivery mechanism, but since PathWatcher objects are all statically rooted, we cannot use the standard .NET eventing mechanism, lest it root the owning objects also. PathWatcher keeps a weak reference to its owning object and will attempt to cast it to IPathChangedSink in order to deliver notifications.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.IPathChangedSink.PathChanged(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.PathWatcher)
member.summary: The owning object is notified when something has changed on disk at or underneath the path being monitored. The method is called on a threadpool thread, and is only called every N seconds (configurable).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.PathWatcher.Poll
member.summary: Retrieves a report of the paths which have changed under this PathWatcher's observations since the last time Poll() was invoked.
member.returns: A PathWatcherReport object which is now the property of the caller.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.PathWatcher.PathWatcherManager
member.summary:
Manages the number of PathWatchers that are active in this appdomain. This class is necessary for two reasons.
- Objects which own PathWatchers (such as Workspace, indirectly through LocalWorkspaceScanner) may not be IDisposable, but PathWatcher is -- and PathWatcher has a native handle. Rather than let the finalizer take care of closing the handle, this class is responsible for disposing PathWatchers whose owners have been collected.
- PathWatchers have native handles whose number should be tightly bounded to avoid running away with native resources in pathological situations, such as a user working with 50 local Workspace objects simultaneously or in succession.
Active "management" of PathWatchers happens either on a calling thread which we hijack for a moment, or on a threadpool thread when a long-running timer fires.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.PathWatcher.PathWatcherManager.#ctor

member.summary: Called by PathWatcher objects to indicate that they have released a directory handle.

member.summary: Helper function to manage PathWatcher count in this appdomain.

member.summary: Called by the PathWatcher class when it is about to start watching for the first time. Each PathWatcher calls Register at most once.
member.param: PathWatcher to register with the PathWatcherManager

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.WorkspaceWatcher.LocationChanged
member.summary: When the location of the workspace (local or server) changes, the Workspace object should inform the WorkspaceWatcher by calling this method. The WorkspaceWatcher will respond by either spinning up PathWatchers or spinning them down, as appropriate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.WorkspaceWatcher.EnsureWatching
member.summary:
If a PathWatcher is created but the path to watch on disk does not exist, then the PathWatcher will not start asynchronously watching for changes on disk. (It will still be invalidated, and our polling architecture will work fine.)
Call EnsureWatching to try and start each PathWatcher again. This is called every time we perform baseline maintenance on the local workspace properties table, for example.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.WorkspaceWatcher.IsAsynchronous
member.summary:
True if the WorkspaceWatcher should, in the background, scan the workspace for changes in response to local disk events noticed by the PathWatchers. The scan of the workspace may detect new pending changes and alert subscribers to the PendingChangesChanged and PendingChangeCandidatesChanged events on VersionControlServer.
The background scans are rate-limited by the QueuedActionLimiter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileBackedPendingChangeCollection
member.summary:
A collection of pending changes.
This object has two states -- the open state, where pending changes can be added with AddPendingChange(), and the closed state, where the pending changes in the collection can be enumerated. The object is created in the open state, and transitioned to the closed state by calling Close(). The object cannot transition from the closed state to the open state.
All PendingChange objects in a FileBackedPendingChangeCollection must be PendingChanges from the same VersionControlServer. The VersionControlServer is provided at construction.
This class stores the provided pending changes as compressed, serialized XML on the local disk.
This class is thread-safe only after Close() has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileBackedPendingChangeCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a FileBackedPendingChangeCollection in the open state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileBackedPendingChangeCollection.#ctor(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.VersionControlServer)
member.summary: Creates a FileBackedPendingChangeCollection in the open state. All of the PendingChange objects added to this FileBackedPendingChangeCollection must be obtained from the provided VersionControlServer.
member.param: VersionControlServer for the PendingChange objects in this collection

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileBackedPendingChangeCollection.#ctor(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.VersionControlServer,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.FileBackedPendingChangeInitializer,System.Object)
member.summary:
Creates a FileBackedPendingChangeCollection in the open state. All of the PendingChange objects added to this FileBackedPendingChangeCollection must be obtained from the provided VersionControlServer.
The FileBackedPendingChangeCollection is marked for lazy initialization. When certain methods are invoked or properties are accessed, the provided delegate will be invoked, whose responsibility is to populate the FileBackedPendingChangeCollection. On invocation, the lazy initializer will be passed the lazyInitializerParameter as a parameter.
The FileBackedPendingChangesCollection will be set to the closed state after invoking your delegate, so calling Close() in the delegate is not necessary.
member.param: VersionControlServer for the PendingChange objects in this collection
A FileBackedPendingChangeInitializer delegate to be called to populate the collection
An object to pass to the lazyInitializer when it is invoked

This method is safe to call whether the collection is open or closed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.TeamProjectFolderOptions
member.summary: This class is used to describe the initial configuration of a newly created team project. This allows the creator to control the initial access, checkin notes, whether or not exclusive checkout is enforced or not and whether or not get latest on checkout is enforced.
This class contains the options used to create a team project folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.TeamProjectFolderOptions.ExclusiveCheckout
member.summary: The ExclusiveCheckout option allows the creator to require all pending changes on items be exclusive, not allowing more than a single user to pend chanes at one time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.TeamProjectFolderOptions.GetLatestOnCheckout
member.summary: The GetLatestOnCheckout option allows the creator to require all attempts to pend edits on items to retrieve the latest version of those items as part of the operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.TeamProjectFolderOptions.Permissions
member.summary: This is used to configure what the default set of permissions for a set of users and groups will be to the tree when the tree is created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.TeamProjectFolderOptions.SourceProject
member.summary: The branch source is used to denote the source location in the tree to branch the TeamProject from. The branches are always created by branching the latest version of the source tree. If the Source Project is not specified then the team project folder is created as a new emtpy folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.TeamProjectFolderOptions.TeamProject
member.summary: The team project folder is a required value and specifies the name of the folder created for the team project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.WorkingFolder.TranslateServerItemToLocalItem(System.String)
member.summary:
Uses this WorkingFolder object as the closest mapping to translate the provided server item to a local item.
Do not call this method on WorkingFolders which are cloaks, as they have no local path. Furthermore, this method does not respect the Depth property of a WorkingFolder.
member.param: The server item to translate. This must be a subitem of this WorkingFolder's server item.
member.returns: The local item of the provided server item

member.returns: The server item of the provided local item

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.CheckIn(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.PendingChange[],System.String)
member.summary: Given a set of pending changes from this workspace, check in the pending changes to the server. A checkin is an atomic operation. All changes will be checked in or none will. If the checkin is successful, a positive changeset number will be returned from this method. If the set of pending changes for checkin is null, the server will attempt to check in all changes in the workspace, but this operation is not valid if any pending changes in the workspace are edits or adds, as content will not have been uploaded to the server.
member.param: The set of pending changes (from this workspace) to check in (can be null)
The comment to be associated with this checkin (can be null)
member.returns: If successful, a positive changeset number for this checkin.

member.summary: Given a set of pending changes from this workspace, check in the pending changes to the server. A checkin is an atomic operation. All changes will be checked in or none will. If the checkin is successful, a positive changeset number will be returned from this method. If the set of pending changes for checkin is null, the server will attempt to check in all changes in the workspace, but this operation is not valid if any pending changes in the workspace are edits or adds, as content will not have been uploaded to the server.
member.param: The set of pending changes (from this workspace) to check in (can be null)
The comment to be associated with this checkin (can be null)
Checkin note information associated with this checkin (can be null)
Associated work item information (can be null)
Checkin policy override information (can be null)
member.returns: If successful, a positive changeset number for this checkin.

member.summary: Given a set of pending changes from this workspace, check in the pending changes to the server. A checkin is an atomic operation. All changes will be checked in or none will. If the checkin is successful, a positive changeset number will be returned from this method. If the set of pending changes for checkin is null, the server will attempt to check in all changes in the workspace, but this operation is not valid if any pending changes in the workspace are edits or adds, as content will not have been uploaded to the server.
member.param: The set of pending changes (from this workspace) to check in (can be null)

If null, the author of the changeset will be the user making the CheckIn call. If non-null, and the user making the CheckIn call has CheckInOther permission, the author will be set to the provided value.

member.summary: Given a set of pending changes from this workspace, check in the pending changes to the server. A checkin is an atomic operation. All changes will be checked in or none will. If the checkin is successful, a positive changeset number will be returned from this method. If the set of pending changes for checkin is null, the server will attempt to check in all changes in the workspace, but this operation is not valid if any pending changes in the workspace are edits or adds, as content will not have been uploaded to the server.
member.param: An instance of WorkspaceCheckInParameters that you create to supply instructions for this checkin, such as (but not limited to) the items to check in, the comment associated with the changeset, and the associated work items.
member.returns: If successful, a positive changeset number for this checkin.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.CheckInInternal(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.WorkspaceCheckInParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Private implementation of CheckIn. New parameters should be added as properties on the WorkspaceCheckInParameters object. Do not add new overloads to CheckIn.
member.param: An instance of WorkspaceCheckInParameters that you create to supply instructions for this checkin, such as (but not limited to) the items to check in, the comment associated with the changeset, and the associated work items.
member.returns: If successful, a positive changeset number for this checkin.

member.summary: Wraps the checkin webmethod and calls the applicable method based on the server's capabilities. Called by CheckInInternal.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.GetExtendedItems(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ItemSpec[],Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.DeletedState,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.ItemType)
member.summary: For each input ItemSpec, retrieves a list of extended items in the repository that match the specified criteria. If the 'path' argument is a file, returns a set of items containing just that file. If the 'path' is a folder, returns a set of items containing all items in that folder. If the 'path' contains a wildcard character, returns a set of items in the specified folder that match the wildcard.
member.param: The item specifiers for the item(s) being listed, may be server or local
A flag representing whether to return deleted items, non-deleted items, or both
A flag representing whether to return files, folders, or both
member.returns: An array of ExtendedItem arrays, each containing the matching ExtendedItem instances associated with each specified ItemSpec

member.summary: For each input ItemSpec, retrieves a list of extended items in the repository that match the specified criteria. If the 'path' contains a wildcard character, returns a set of items in the specified folder that match the wildcard.
member.param: The item specifiers for the item(s) being listed, may be server or local
A flag representing whether to return deleted items, non-deleted items, or both

member.summary: For each input ItemSpec, retrieves a list of extended items in the repository that match the specified criteria. If the 'path' argument is a file, returns a set of items containing just that file. If the 'path' is a folder, returns a set of items containing all items in that folder. If the 'path' contains a wildcard character, returns a set of items in the specified folder that match the wildcard.
member.param: The item specifiers for the item(s) being listed, may be server or local
A flag representing whether to return deleted items, non-deleted items, or both
A flag representing whether to return files, folders, or both
Options
A list of properties to query.
member.returns: An array of ExtendedItem arrays, each containing the matching ExtendedItem instances associated with each specified ItemSpec

member.summary: For each provided ItemSpec, returns a corresponding WorkspaceItemSet containing data about items in the workspace.

The list of properties to be returned on the shelvesets. To get all properties pass a single filter that is simply "*".
True if "merge" should be performed when unshelving. This will file merge and version conflicts for items that have conflicting pending changes and different pended versions respectively.
Prevents any conflicts from being auto resolved even if the option is set in the registry.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.PendRename(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.LockLevel,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves or renames a file or directory. The source may contain wildcards if the target is a directory. The target may never have wildcards. If the target is an existing directory, the source will be moved to be a child of the target.
member.param: The current path, local or server, to the item being renamed. This path may contain wildcards if the destination is a folder
The new path, local or server, for the item
The level of locking for the pending change
if true, the local disk is updated according to the pending changes; if false, the disk is not modified and changes are not acknowledged
if true, look for a local folder existing at the target and tell the server if that is the case; otherwise, do not check
member.returns: The number of items renamed

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.IsScannerAsynchronous
member.summary:
This flag applies only to local workspaces (Location == WorkspaceLocation.Local). If true, then the VersionControlServer which owns this Workspace will fire the PendingChangesChanged and GetCompleted events as soon the disk scanner notices that something has changed on disk. That is, the generation of those events is truly asynchronous. If false, the disk scanner only runs when necessary for correctness -- as a part of calls to this Workspace object's public methods. The events will still fire, but they will fire after the scanned API call which notices them, rather than as soon as they occur on disk.
The default is false. Setting this flag to true may decrease performance, but it is useful for the construction of a feature such as an always-up-to-date list of pending changes in the workspace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.Workspace.AsyncUploadOperation.BufferWriteStream
member.summary: Whether or not to issue new child upload requests with write stream buffering enabled. Usually this is false; but under certain web proxy scenarios, not buffering the write stream can be be pathologically slower because the upload logic may have to retry each request with buffering enabled (after failing once with it disabled). We detect this pathological behavior and set a flag that turns on write stream buffering 'permanently' for the rest of the upload operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Client.WorkspaceVersionSpec.Identifier
member.summary: Identifier for this version spec in command-line usage.
Retrieves an enumerable collection of Changeset objects matching the specified criteria.
member.param: The item whose history is to be retrieved. The last path part may include the ? and * wildcard characters, i.e. $/Abc/def/*.cs. The item may be a server or a local path.
A VersionSpec describing the point in time at which the path provided in the path parameter should be resolved to an item. The most common value to provide for this parameter is VersionSpec.Latest.

If the path provided in the path parameter is deleted at the version provided in the version parameter, then the deletion ID of the particular deleted item you are referring to should be provided here. The most common value to provide for this parameter is zero. If you are querying a TFS 2010 server or later, then you can safely provide zero in all cases.

The recursion type to apply to the provided path. When querying the history of files, it is common to provide RecursionType.None. When querying the history of a folder, it is common to provide RecursionType.Full.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query to the set of changesets authored by a particular identity. For TFS 2010 servers and earlier, this parameter must be in the form "DOMAIN\user". Later servers accept identities in this format, as well as display names ("Maggie Carrido"). The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, indicating that the query should not be restricted by author.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query along the time axis. The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, to indicate that the range of the history query goes all the way back to the start of the repository.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query along the time axis. The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, to indicate that the range of the history query starts with the latest changeset in the repository.

This parameter allows the caller to limit the number of results returned. QueryHistory pages results back from the server on demand, so limiting your own consumption of the returned IEnumerable is almost as effective (from a performance perspective) as providing a fixed value here. The most common value to provide for this parameter is Int32.MaxValue.

This parameter allows the caller to request that the returned Changeset objects include Change objects (the manifest of the changeset). If false, the Changeset objects returned will contain only the changeset metadata. Note that even when this parameter is set to true, the set of returned Change objects is scoped to the provided path and recursion.

If this parameter is false, then the (path, version, deletionId) tuple is resolved to an item and the history is performed on that item, tracking across renames. If this parameter is true, then the tuple is not resolved. Instead, all changesets which have an item with the name "path" (or beneath it, if the query is recursive), are returned. That is, the query is on a particular "namespace slot" (slot mode) rather than on a particular item. The most common value to provide for this parameter is true.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of Changeset objects matching the specified criteria.

member.summary: Retrieves an enumerable collection of Changeset objects matching the specified criteria.
member.param: The item whose history is to be retrieved. The last path part may include the ? and * wildcard characters, i.e. $/Abc/def/*.cs. The item may be a server or a local path.
A VersionSpec describing the point in time at which the path provided in the path parameter should be resolved to an item. The most common value to provide for this parameter is VersionSpec.Latest.

If the path provided in the path parameter is deleted at the version provided in the version parameter, then the deletion ID of the particular deleted item you are referring to should be provided here. The most common value to provide for this parameter is zero. If you are querying a TFS 2010 server or later, then you can safely provide zero in all cases.

The recursion type to apply to the provided path. When querying the history of files, it is common to provide RecursionType.None. When querying the history of a folder, it is common to provide RecursionType.Full.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query to the set of changesets authored by a particular identity. For TFS 2010 servers and earlier, this parameter must be in the form "DOMAIN\user". Later servers accept identities in this format, as well as display names ("Maggie Carrido"). The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, indicating that the query should not be restricted by author.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query along the time axis. The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, to indicate that the range of the history query goes all the way back to the start of the repository.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query along the time axis. The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, to indicate that the range of the history query starts with the latest changeset in the repository.

This parameter allows the caller to limit the number of results returned. QueryHistory pages results back from the server on demand, so limiting your own consumption of the returned IEnumerable is almost as effective (from a performance perspective) as providing a fixed value here. The most common value to provide for this parameter is Int32.MaxValue.

This parameter allows the caller to request that the returned Changeset objects include Change objects (the manifest of the changeset). If false, the Changeset objects returned will contain only the changeset metadata. Note that even when this parameter is set to true, the set of returned Change objects is scoped to the provided path and recursion. The most common value to provide for this parameter is false.

If this parameter is false, then the (path, version, deletionId) tuple is resolved to an item and the history is performed on that item, tracking across renames. If this parameter is true, then the tuple is not resolved. Instead, all changesets which have an item with the name "path" (or beneath it, if the query is recursive), are returned. That is, the query is on a particular "namespace slot" (slot mode) rather than on a particular item. The most common value to provide for this parameter is true.

This parameter applies only when includeChanges is set to true. Set this parameter to true to have the server generate download URLs and include them with the Change objects returned in each Changeset. This allows the client to download the file content associated with a particular Change object with one round-trip to the server instead of two. Setting this parameter to true increases the computation time on the server for the QueryHistory call, as well as the size of the result set on the wire. For performance reasons, you should set this flag only if you intend to download the content the returned Change objects. The most common value to provide for this parameter is false.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of Changeset objects matching the specified criteria.

member.summary: Retrieves an enumerable collection of Changeset objects matching the specified criteria.
member.param: The item whose history is to be retrieved. The last path part may include the ? and * wildcard characters, i.e. $/Abc/def/*.cs. The item may be a server or a local path.
A VersionSpec describing the point in time at which the path provided in the path parameter should be resolved to an item. The most common value to provide for this parameter is VersionSpec.Latest.

If the path provided in the path parameter is deleted at the version provided in the version parameter, then the deletion ID of the particular deleted item you are referring to should be provided here. The most common value to provide for this parameter is zero. If you are querying a TFS 2010 server or later, then you can safely provide zero in all cases.

The recursion type to apply to the provided path. When querying the history of files, it is common to provide RecursionType.None. When querying the history of a folder, it is common to provide RecursionType.Full.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query to the set of changesets authored by a particular identity. For TFS 2010 servers and earlier, this parameter must be in the form "DOMAIN\user". Later servers accept identities in this format, as well as display names ("Maggie Carrido"). The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, indicating that the query should not be restricted by author.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query along the time axis. The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, to indicate that the range of the history query goes all the way back to the start of the repository.

This parameter allows the caller to restrict the history query along the time axis. The most common value to provide for this parameter is null, to indicate that the range of the history query starts with the latest changeset in the repository.

This parameter allows the caller to limit the number of results returned. QueryHistory pages results back from the server on demand, so limiting your own consumption of the returned IEnumerable is almost as effective (from a performance perspective) as providing a fixed value here. The most common value to provide for this parameter is Int32.MaxValue.

This parameter allows the caller to request that the returned Changeset objects include Change objects (the manifest of the changeset). If false, the Changeset objects returned will contain only the changeset metadata. Note that even when this parameter is set to true, the set of returned Change objects is scoped to the provided path and recursion. The most common value to provide for this parameter is false.

If this parameter is false, then the (path, version, deletionId) tuple is resolved to an item and the history is performed on that item, tracking across renames. If this parameter is true, then the tuple is not resolved. Instead, all changesets which have an item with the name "path" (or beneath it, if the query is recursive), are returned. That is, the query is on a particular "namespace slot" (slot mode) rather than on a particular item. The most common value to provide for this parameter is true.

This parameter applies only when includeChanges is set to true. Set this parameter to true to have the server generate download URLs and include them with the Change objects returned in each Changeset. This allows the client to download the file content associated with a particular Change object with one round-trip to the server instead of two. Setting this parameter to true increases the computation time on the server for the QueryHistory call, as well as the size of the result set on the wire. For performance reasons, you should set this flag only if you intend to download the content the returned Change objects. The most common value to provide for this parameter is false.

By default, the results are from versionTo to versionFrom (reverse order). If you want the results to be returned in ascending order instead (from versionFrom to versionTo), set this flag to true. This flag requires a TFS 2010 or later server to have any effect. The most common value to provide for this parameter is false.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of Changeset objects matching the specified criteria.

member.summary:
Retrieves a list of all items in the repository that match the specified path and version. If the 'path' argument is a file, returns a set of items containing just that file. If the 'path' is a folder, returns a set of items containing all items in that folder. If the 'path' contains a wildcard character, returns a set of items in the specified folder that match the wildcard.
Note, specifying either itemPropertyFilters or itemAttributeFilters will only work against a TFS 11 or newer server. If you need to retrieve attributes on items against a TFS 2010 or older server then you will need to use the GetVersionedItemProperty method.

member.summary: Gets the changes within a changeset Allows the caller to page changes back from the server.
member.param: The changeset for which to get changes

If true, the server will include the information needed to download files. Only set this to true if you are going to be downloading the files using the objects that are returned. The call will be faster and require less bandwidth when this parameter is false.
The # of items to return.

Instructs the server to return items which sort after this item. If null, the server will begin from the start of the changeset. This parameter should be null in the first call to this method, and then should be the last seen value on subsequent calls

member.summary:
QueryMergesExtended is used to find the source changes for a given ItemSpec in specific version range. The result is the set of changes as ExtendedMerge's. Which contain the source of the merge (item, version, deletionId, and change), as well as the changeset details.
The changeset is not a completed object. Only the owner, committer, date, comment, and changesetId are filled in. No items, release notes or other data.
member.param: Target item of the merge to find source merges
The version of the target being identified
The start of the range to retrieve merges
The end of the range to retrieve merges
member.returns: Set of ExtendedMerges for the item and range specified

member.summary:
QueryMergesExtended is used to find the source changes for a given ItemSpec in specific version range. The result is the set of changes as ExtendedMerge's. Which contain the source of the merge (item, version, deletionId, and change), as well as the changeset details.
The changeset is not a completed object. Only the owner, committer, date, comment, and changesetId are filled in. No items, release notes or other data.
member.param: Target item of the merge to find source merges
The version of the target being identified
The start of the range to retrieve merges
The end of the range to retrieve merges
Options to use in Query merges extended

member.summary: Destroy the subtree represented by itemSpec.
member.param: The workspace this operation is being performed in if there is one.
The local or server path that will be recursively destroyed
The version spec to resolve itemSpec with
The simple version spec (not label or workspace) that influences keepHistory behavior

The set of destroy options KeepHistory: If set to true this means that destroy only removes the content of every version of a file up to but not including the changeset represented by stopAt Force: If set this means that destroy will asynchronously kick off content garbage collection Preview: If set then no database data will actually be deleted, only the list of items that would have been destroyed are returned.
member.returns: The list of items that were destroyed

member.summary: Destroy the subtree represented by itemSpec.
member.param: The workspace this operation is being performed in if there is one.
The local or server path that will be recursively destroyed
The version spec to resolve itemSpec with
The simple version spec (not label or workspace) that influences keepHistory behavior

The set of destroy options KeepHistory: If set to true this means that destroy only removes the content of every version of a file up to but not including the changeset represented by stopAt Force: If set this means that destroy will asynchronously kick off content garbage collection Preview: If set then no database data will actually be deleted, only the list of items that would have been destroyed are returned. Silent: If set then return no data to the client. AffectedChanges: If set the pending changes and shelved changes that will be destroyed will be returned in affectedPendingChanges and affectedShelvedChanges. This can only be set if Preview is set. If set then the return value array will be empty.
The pending changes that will be destroyed.
